column10: b"b' ThreadCachedInt race condition'"
b'b" When a thread dies
column11: the destructor of the IntCache object is called to pass on its val_ value to the parent\'s target_ variable.  During the time the destructor is running
column12: if readFull() is called
column13: this thread is left out by accessAllThreads() in ThreadLocalPtr.  And if the destructor has not yet called flush() (see code below)
column14: the val_ of the IntCache object is left out of the total. So
column16: if the correct value to be returned by readFull() is 1000
column17: and the value of val_ of the dying thread is 100
column18: readFull() ends up returning 900 in this situation. Would appreciate a  if anyone has one.  Thanks.  "'

column10: b"b' Suggestion for fix:  ThreadLocalPtr should not allow destruction of thread local state and calls to accessAllThreads() to happen simultaneously.'"
